item.title: A Bootstrap 4 hackable WordPress Theme
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
Notes from the dev For the Brilliant Coding blog, I built a new WordPress theme called: Brilliant Coding Alpha. Previously I had used existing WordPress themes, which were great, but lacked some of the flexibility I wanted. Instead I wanted something a little more “hackable”, after some research I found a few “theme builders” that […]

The post A Bootstrap 4 hackable WordPress Theme appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.

item.title: Refactoring to Factory Function in PHP
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
This is a quick example to show a simple PHP refactoring for object creation.Â  Specifically our goal is to use static functions to better encapsulate our object constructor calls. In this example, we assume that we have a flexible message constructor that allows us to build messages given some text and time information. public function […]

The post Refactoring to Factory Function in PHP appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.

item.title: Open Source programming environments that make coding easier
item.dc:creator: Matthew Jackowski
item.description:
A programmer’s life is hard enough keeping up-to-date on the latest technologies, understanding product specifications, and debugging issues. These programming environments help keep programmer sane by offering integrated syntax coloring, auto-completion, debugging tools and more. The main tools on this list are also all Open Source projects themselves. This enables you to directly contribute to […]

The post Open Source programming environments that make coding easier appeared first on Brilliant Coding Blog.
